New Records: Australia made a world record T20 international powerplay score with 113 runs in the six over powerplay, surpassing the 102 made by South Africa against the West Indies last year.
Key Match Events: Jake Fraser-McGurk was caught for a third-ball duck
Oli Hairs miscued a pull and was caught by Marsh
Inglis took a superb flying catch off Abbott to dismiss George Munsey for 28 off 25
Bartlett picked up Brandon McMullen (19 off 22), caught by debutant Fraser Jake-McGurk
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Marsh said 'I thought all-round we had a great start to the series.'

Head said 'Nice way to get underway, I was a little nervous coming in, we've had a bit of a break, so nice for me and the captain to get some runs. That's my role, to maximise the powerplay and I think we did that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The visitors took less than 10 overs to chase Scotland's 9-154, winning the match by seven wickets.
The match was played at the Grange, Edinburgh.
Australia still has to face England in three T20s and five ODIs.
Others: Sean Abbott took 3-39, Xavier Bartlett was the pick with 2-23 from his four overs, Adam Zampa (2-33) and Riley Meredith (2-34) also delivered their full complement while Cam Green (1-12) and Stoinis (0-10) shared a quota.
